result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Owen Widish

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
The parties contacted the Circuit Court Office and scheduled a status conference (possible plea) for December 13, 2022 at 3:00 pm.
Exhibit #3 ; Detective Erdman's Deputy Report from Incident G22-01664.
Exhibit #2 ; Detective Erdman's Deputy Report from Incident G22-01664.
Exhibit #1 ; Detective Erdman's Deputy Report from Incident G22-01664.

2:30 PM Defendant Nathan Owen Widish in court.  Attorney Andrea N Winder in court for Nathan Owen Widish.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Curtis Erdman sworn in under oath to testify. DA Nolen presents Exhibit #1; Detective Erdman's Deputy Report for Incident G22-01664. DA Nolen moves to admit Exhibit #1. No objection from Atty Winder. The Court admits. Detective Erdman identifies the defendant. DA Nolen presents Exhibit #2; Detective Erdman's Deputy Report for Incident G22-01664. DA Nolen moves to admit Exhibit #2. No objection from Atty Winder. The Court admits. DA Nolen presents Exhibit #3; Detective Erdman's Deputy Report for Incident G22-01664. DA Nolen moves to admit Exhibit #3. No objection from Atty Winder. The Court admits. Cross. Argument. DA Nolen requests the Judge find probable cause and bind the matter over for trial. Atty Winder objects to probable cause being found and waived formal reading. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Information follows the amended criminal complaint. Atty Winder states the DE will stand mute and waive formal reading. The Court directs the Clerk to enter not guilty plea's on the defendants behalf.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
and Motion for Additional Time to File Pre-Trial Motions
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:16 PM Defendant Nathan Owen Widish not in court.  Attorney Craig Nolen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrea N Winder appeared by video for Nathan Owen Widish. Parties have stipulated to reschedule the preliminary hearing. Bond continues. Matter set over.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Demand For Discovery, Notice of Intent To Use Statements of Defendant and DNA Evidence
Clerk emailed WCCC to GCSD dispatch

Violation: 4 counts Child Sexual Exploitation- Produce, Perform, etc., Poss Child Porn
Issuing Agency: GCSD
No use or possession of any cellular phones with internet capability
No contact with any persons under the age of 18 except for his immediate family members
No use of the internet, except for reputable digital video streaming such as Netflix, Hulu, HBO Max, YoutubeTV, SlingTV, Peacock, Paramount+, Discovery+, Disney+, ESPN+, etc.
